turn.0: ELI5: How can some "infinites" be bigger than others? Doesn't that contradict the very definition of "infinite"?
turn.1: not finite doesn't mean not comparable.
turn.2: Only finite things can be compared. It's pretty obvious why.
turn.3: Enlighten me. Prove with mathematical logic that only finite things can be compared.
turn.4: Jesus Christ do you seriously not understand this
turn.5: I don't think you understand this so I'm testing that by asking you to prove it.
turn.6: What is comparison?   A 5m long ruler and a 2m long ruler. The first ruler is 250% the length of the second  A 4.5m long ruler and a 2m long ruler. The first is 225% the length of the second.  A 50m ruler and a 0.5m ruler. The first is 10000% the length of the second.  When one of these """numbers is Infinite"""... Just nothing. You just can't do this.  All numbers are =0 when compared to infinity. That's illogical, therefore you can't compare infinity
turn.7: you can say one is infinitely larger than the other.
turn.8: No. Everything is =0 when compared to infinity. That'd mean Infinity=0
turn.9: how is saying something is infinitely bigger than something else not valid?
turn.10: It's not. We say this a lot but we're doing it wrong. Like when we give things a name. We talk about black people, white people, deserts, tables, chairs. Although there really isn't such a thing.
turn.11: you can't just say it's not and expect me to believe you.
turn.12: It's not valid because infinity is impossible
turn.13: not finite does not mean impossible
turn.14: Infinity is ‘impossible’ to define because describing or defining something requires it to have a point of differentiation with something else which is comparable; a finite quality.
turn.15: That doesn't make any sense at all, nor does it even attempt to justify itself.
turn.16: The definition is not-finite. The premise is you can't compare that which is infinite. The other premise is mathematics is getting results by operating with something they call infinite. Conclusion is what mathematics calls infinity is not infinite.
turn.17: >The premise is you can't compare that which is infinite.  I reject your premise as baseless. Your making infinity mean something other than what it means.
turn.18: No, but they always come with the other, which, really, makes them the same thing
turn.19: you say that and expect me to believe you? My computer and the squirrel outside are incomparable but there is nothing infinite about either.
turn.21: As comparable as infinity is. You still have given me no reason to believe that infinity means the same thing as incomparable. You just expect me to believe you.
turn.22: >As comparable as infinity is  Yikers  You could count the amount of atoms of hidrogen that are in the squirrel and the amount that are in the computer. 50 trillion vs 40 trillion? 125%.  How, exactly, do you even pretend to get a number from "comparing" infinity?
turn.23: Well, I say that X is infinity greater than Y. It works, you should try it.
turn.27: No I didn't. You asked how I compare infinite things to finite things and I said I say one is infinitely bigger than the other.
